column1: The day before the king and his family left
column2: he held a feast. Everyone attended. Leopards
column6: birds and even ants came to the feast. The king addressed the people
column7: "My family and I are going away to the other part of Okugbe Island. We want to feel the pain that other people feel." People whispered amongst themselves. The elders did not believe him. But who could question the king? So
column8: everyone drank and feasted. The next day
column9: the king and his family sailed away. For the first two days
column10: the boats rolled through the waters. The sky was clear
column12: and the trip was a happy one. On the third day
column13: the sea became rough. The sky became cloudy. A great storm came upon them. The boats were overturned. The king was helpless as his wealth and family were lost to the sea. The king alone survived.
